#; Tag#: 05.12.30.0034
#; Issue#: IB16840050
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Flash
#; Symptom: When BIOS lock is enable and  FPRR is disable, the H2OOAE shell version is fail (cannot update the data into flash part).
#; RootCause: The function "SetUntrustedMode" will be triggered at ExitBootService. It isn!|t triggered when the system boot to shell.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Register the callback function earlier to EndOfDxeEventGroup.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB04530000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#; Tag#: 05.12.30.0034
#; Issue#: IB12740214
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: TPM
#; Symptom: Build fail and show "error B4000: Instance of library class [ResetSystemLib] is not found" if the system doesn!|t implement or define the instance of ResetSystemLib in the DSC file.
#; RootCause: ResetSystemLib is platform dependent implementation. Once the platform doesn!|t implement it, the compiler error will happen.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Use ResetPpi instead of ResetSystemLib to do the system reset.
#; This solution is form Kernel 05.23.18.
#; SolutionDependency: IB12740214 fixes side effect of IB12740213 (Adopted in Tag#: 05.12.30.0034)
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   3. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   4. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   5. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   6. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   7. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   8. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   9. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\DnX_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE.bin
#;   10. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\DnX_EMMC_X64_RELEASE.bin
#;   11. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\Tcg2Pei\Tcg2Pei.c
#;   12. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\Tcg2Pei\Tcg2Pei.inf
#; 
#; Tag#: 05.12.30.0034
#; Issue#: IB12740213
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: TPM
#; Symptom: If OS fails to send TPM Shutdown command to the TPM and lead TPM State is not saved, PEI code will still continue to boot and leave the TPM hierarchies unlocked.
#; RootCause: PEI code doesn't lock the TPM hierarchies in that case.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: If TPM Startup fail on S3 resume, PEI code will -
#; (1) Cap PCR0 ~ PCR7 with event data = 0x01 (already implemented in IB12740210)
#; (2) Disable Endorsement Hierarchy & Storage Hierarchy
#; (3) If PcdH2OTpmS3StartupFailureReboot is TRUE, reboot the system. PcdH2OTpmS3StartupFailureReboot default is FALSE.
#; Please refer to "P:\Engineering\Kernel\Core\H2O 5.0\InsydeH2O 50 Feature PCDs Guide.docx" for details.
#; This solution is form Kernel 05.23.14.
#; SolutionDependency: IB12740213 enhances IB12740210 (adopted in 05.12.30.0034)
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\Tcg2Pei\Tcg2Pei.inf
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   3. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   4. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   5. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   6. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   7. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   8. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   9. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\DnX_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE.bin
#;   10. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\DnX_EMMC_X64_RELEASE.bin
#;   11. BroxtonChipsetPkg\BroxtonChipsetPkg.dec
#;   12. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\Tcg2Pei\Tcg2Pei.c
#;   13. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Package.dsc
#; 
#; Tag#: 05.12.30.0034
#; Issue#: IB12740210
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: TPM
#; Symptom: If TPM2_Startup(TPM_SU_STATE) to return an error, the system firmware that resumes from S3 doesn't deal with a TPM2_Startup error appropriately.
#; RootCause: A TPM Resume error handling is lacking.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Follows EDKII rev.17002 to issue a TPM2_Startup(TPM_SU_CLEAR) command and configuring the device securely by extending a separator with an error digest (0x01) into PCRs 0 through 7.
#; This solution is from Kernel 05.23.10.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB04530000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\Tcg2Pei\
#;   2. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\Tcg2Pei\Tcg2Pei.c
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   3. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   4. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   5. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   6. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   7. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   8. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   9. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\DnX_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE.bin
#;   10. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\DnX_EMMC_X64_RELEASE.bin
#;   11. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Package.dsc
#; 
#; Tag#: 05.12.30.0034
#; Issue#: IB02961059
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: Security
#; Symptom: (Security)
#; RootCause: (Security)
#; Description: (PSIRT-TA-Tiano-2018-012: CVE-2018-12182)
#; The ReadSaveStateRegister() function in SmramSaveState.c includes an additional call to ReadSaveStateRegisterByIndex() that could
#; be potentially utilized as an intermediary for passing information beyond a trusted compute boundary.
#; Solution:  Remove support for checking ins/outs in SMM save state. Otherwise if ins/outs occurs in one thread during SMI, a page fault will occur.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   3. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   4. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   5. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#; Tag#: 05.12.30.0034
#; Issue#: IB07010758
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: Security
#; Symptom: (Security)
#; RootCause: (Security)
#; Description: (PSIRT-TA-Tiano-2018-011: CVE-2018-12181) Security Effect: CWE-121: Stack-based Buffer Overflow
#; When the HII database contains a Bitmap who claims as 4-bit or 8-bit per pixel, but the palette
#; contains more than 16(2^4) or 256(2^8) colors, stack overflow occurs.
#; The image data is not digitally signed. There is no security claims or secure design around this usage model.
#; There is only data validation in consuming the image data.
#; Solution: Change to use MIN() macro to limit the number of palette to array size.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\InsydeModulePkg\Universal\UserInterface\

#; Tag#: 05.12.30.0034
#; Issue#: IB02961058
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: Security
#; Symptom: (Security)
#; RootCause: (Security)
#; Description: (PSIRT-TA-Tiano-2018-010: CVE-2018-12180) Security Effect: CWE-125: Out-of-bounds Read
#; When registering a Ram disk whose size is not a multiple of 512 bytes, the BlockIo protocol
#; produced by the RamDiskDxe driver will incur memory read/write overrun.  Memory overrun will
#; happen when reading/writing the last block on the Ram disk.
#; Solution: Change to use size of MASTER_BOOT_RECORD as buffer size to read MBR data to prevent from memory overrun.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Disk\

#; Category: Security

#; Tag#: 05.12.30.0034
#; Issue#: IB02961041
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: Security
#; Symptom: (Mantis:0001887) Logic error in FV parsing allows local/physical attacker to bypass chain-of-trust integrity checks.
#; RootCause: If ExtHeaderOffset isn't 0 the FFS header is aligned to 8 boundary, but this alignment is absent when ExtHeaderOffset is 0.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: aligned FFS header to 8 boundary no matter ExtHeaderOffset is 0 or not.
#; This solution is from Kernel.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; 
#; RelatedFiles:

#; Tag#: 05.12.30.0034
#; Issue#: IB02961040
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: Security
#; Symptom: If changing MemoryTypeInfo variable by other application, system may hang up in early DXE phase.
#; RootCause: MemoryTypeInfo variable contains sensitive variable and should not be allowed to modify by shell application or at runtime.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Use variable lock protocol to lock MemoryTypeInfo variable to prevent from it is modified by other application after end of DXE event.
#; This solution is from Kernel.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\

#; Tag#: 05.12.30.0033
#; Issue#: IB16840005
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Tool
#; Symptom: Use H2OUVE to do -gv (Dump variable) then do -sv (Update variable) and then do -gv again, the 2nd time -gv cannot get whole variables.
#; RootCause: The -sv will set READ-ONLY variable into variable region, then break the get next variable sequence.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Do not set READ-ONLY variable into variable region.
#; SolutionDependency: None.
#; Reviewer: IB06740000

#; Issue#: IB15550030
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: SMBIOS
#; Symptom: (ITS:0041952) SMBIOS reported incorrect Part Number of DIMM2 Memory.
#; RootCause: RC 1.3.0 modified the strings in SmbiosType17Strings.c which we used 
#;            for looking up the SMBus address number and caused Part Number display error.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Remove source override for SMBIOS Type 17 data update from BroxtonChipsetPkg (SmbiosDxe.c).
#;           2. Modify DetectDimms.c and Spd.h in BroxtonSiPkg to collect Part Number data.
#; SolutionDependency: RC 1.3.0 IB03090437 (Tag: 05.11.51.0026) and IB15550021(Tag: 05.11.34.0020).

#; Tag#: 05.12.09.0029
#; Issue#: IB15590029
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: When installing Linux(Ubuntu 16.10), then it invokes runtime services. The system hangs at AllocatePool().
#; RootCause: The Ubuntu installation procedure will use Runtime Services. It will hang at the following two points because calling
#;            gBS->AllocatePool in non-SMM.
#;            1. "Installing GRUB 2" will invoke Query_Variable_Info, hanging on CseVariableGetStorageUsage().
#;            2. "Instaliing dev/sda" will invoke Set_Variable, hanging on ComputeHmacSha256Signature().
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Use AllocatePool in SMM, replacing gBS->AllocatePool.
#;           1. When calling QueryVariableInfo runtime service, run into SMM via SMI.
#;           2. Remove un-needed code segment in VariableServicesSetVariable.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB04530000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   3. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   4. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   5. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   6. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   7. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   8. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   9. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\DnX_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE.bin
#;   10. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\DnX_EMMC_X64_RELEASE.bin
#;   11. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\SecureBoot.c

#; Tag#: 05.12.09.0029
#; Issue#: IB15590028
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: When installing Linux (Ubuntu 16.10), then it invokes gRT->SetVariable, and the system will hang.
#; RootCause: The system hangs at SetHeci2Active() when polling for HECI device idle.
#; The memory space (Assigned via HECI BAR) is broken by Linux, so HECI2 device will not work correctly.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Add HECI2 and HECI3 devices into PCI skip table to avoid Linux break the contents.
#; SolutionDependency: None

#; Tag#: 05.12.09.0028
#; Issue#: IB07250279
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: Calling gRT->SetVariable () may return EFI_ACCESS_DENIED in timer event callback function
#;          and cause system cannot work properly.
#; RootCause: Calling gRT->SetVariable () in timer event callback function may interrupt previous gRT->SetVariable ()
#;            call and cause this function returns EFI_ACCESS_DENIED since reentry this function is forbidden.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Raise TPL in variable related function to prevent variable related functions are interrupted by event at boot time.
#;           (Integrate Kernel Rev5.2 solution IB02960886 in 05.22.14)
#; SolutionDependency: None.
#; Reviewer: IB04530000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:

#; Tag#: 05.12.02.0027
#; Issue#: IB15550024
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Graphics
#; Symptom: (ITS:0041392) Intel Graphics driver shows yellow bang when changing the boot mode from UEFI to dual boot type in SCU.
#; RootCause: The system always programs "LGBE" field (CsmEnable) as 0, it causes LGR1~3 be set to zero in legacy/dual boot type.
#;            Graphic device shows yellow bang if the values of LGR1~LGR3 are set to zero and the system is booting in legacy support mode.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Sync LGBE (CsmEnable) value with Boot type setting in SCU.
#;              In legacy support modes (dual boot/legacy boot), the value will be set to 1.
#;              In UEFI boot mode, the value will be set to 0.
#;           2. Correct the comment.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB45300000
#; 
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#; Tag#: 05.11.51.0026
#; Issue#: IB11270173
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Variable 
#; Symptom: ITS 41002: Win10x64-Secure Boot Logo Test fail.
#; RootCause: In Secure Boot Logo Test, it will check the default variable (PKDefault, KEKDefault, dbDefault, dbxDefault) from Factory Copy Base "PcdFlashNvStorageFactoryCopyBase".
#;            The IB11270166 copy OBB region from SPI to memory to reduce POST time, but the memory region will be free after booting into OS.
#;            It causes the system can't get correct default variables under OS.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Refine the algorithm: Just copy the DXE FV to memory, but keep the PcdFlashNvStorageFactoryCopyBase in SPI.
#; SolutionDependency: IB11270173 fixes side effect of IB11270166. (Adopted in 05.11.35.0022)
#; Reviewer: IB04530000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin

#; Tag#: 05.11.51.0026
#; Issue#: IB07250263
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Platform
#; Symptom: USB port 4 to 7 are always disabled.
#; RootCause: Platform hardware switch feature will use the USB 2.0 ports settings (ScUsbPort) in the System Configuration.
#;            But the USB port 4 to 7 don't have related setup items so the default value will be set to 0 (disabled),
#;            it causes these ports are always disabled.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Add SC USB port 4 to 7 related setup items, and the default setting is enabled.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07250263 fixes the side effect of IB04530802(Tag: 05.11.51.0026).
#; Reviewer: IB04530000

#; Tag#: 05.11.51.0026
#; Issue#: IB07250262
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Platform
#; Symptom: Network adapters disappeared in device manager.
#; RootCause: PEIMs use different header files cause the data structure is mismatched, so the PCIe root port will be closed.
#;            (PlatformInit.inf, PeiPolicyUpdateLib.inf, ChipsetSvcPei.inf, PeiChipsetSvcLib.inf, and PeiOemSvcKernelLib.inf)
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Change the order of package DEC file in the module's INF file to sync the including path. 
#;           Move the chipset package DEC file before the kernel package DEC file, 
#;           so the module could include the correct header file which is overrode in chipset package.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07250262 fixes the side effect of IB04530802(Tag: 05.11.51.0026).
#; Reviewer: IB04530000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin

#;   6. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin

#;   12. BroxtonChipsetPkg\PlatformInit\Pei\PlatformInit.inf
#; 
#; Tag#: 05.11.51.0026
#; Issue#: IB11270172
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Variable 
#; Symptom: ITS 40907: Some device (ex: SD Card Controller) does not sync Setup setting after flashing BIOS binary (first boot).         
#; RootCause: The status of variable header will be set to VAR_ADDED in PEI phase and the variable data does not update by NVM variable,
#;            Thus cause some device keep previous setting.            
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Sync the variable header state with NVM variable instead of using VAR_ADDED hard code.    
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB06740000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   3. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   4. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   5. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#; Tag#: 05.11.50.0025
#; Issue#: IB10860216
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Flash
#; Symptom: (Code Adjustment)
#; RootCause: (Code Adjustment)
#; Description: After BIOS updated to kernel 05.11.45 (IB15180053), Secure Flash failed when using InsydeH2OFFT_x86_DOS.
#;              PcdSecureFlashOnEspSupport is a switch to decide where to locate the image when doing secure flash.
#;              Kernel don't allocate reserved memory if PcdSecureFlashOnEspSupport is set to TRUE (It will find the image from ESP).
#;              This solution remove boot type check introduced in IB10860214. 
#;              If system needs to do DOS flash, PcdSecureFlashOnEspSupport must sets FALSE to put image in memory.
#; Solution: (Code Adjustment)
#; SolutionDependency: IB10860216 enhances IB10860214.(Adopted in 05.11.43.0023)
#; Reviewer: IB06740000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   3. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   4. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   5. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   6. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   7. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   8. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#; Tag#: 05.11.43.0024
#; Issue#: IB11270169
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: TXE 
#; Symptom: ITS 40663: It will hang no boot device dialog with post code F9 when FDO enable on 05.11.43.0022
#; RootCause: Get/Set non-volatile variable was used by TXE.
#;            If want to access non-volatile variable when TXE invalid that will cause unexpected behavior.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Force to use volatile variable (PcdForceVolatileVariable = TRUE) when TXE be disable (FDO is asserted).  
#; SolutionDependency: None

#; Tag#: 05.11.43.0023
#; Issue#: IB11270168
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: S4 Resume
#; Symptom: In some OEM projects, Resume from S4(Hibernate) become reboot at first time after flash.
#; RootCause: Memory map consistency issue. 
#;            Pei variable service is create by EstablishAndLoadCseVariableStores (),
#;            it will base on varialble size to allocates pages with EfiBootServiceData memory type.
#;            When Pei have to allocates runtime memory, if the variable size is difference at next post and greater than page size, 
#;            the runtime memory offset will be change and then cause to S4 resume fail.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Force to allocate maximum size to prevent runtime memory offset change.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB06740000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   3. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   4. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   5. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   6. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   7. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   8. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   9. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\DnX_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE.bin
#;   10. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\DnX_EMMC_X64_RELEASE.bin
#;   11. BroxtonSiPkg\Library\Private\BaseCseVariableStorageLib\BaseCseVariableStorageLib.c
#;

#; Tag#: 05.11.43.0023
#; Issue#: IB10860215
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: PS2
#; Symptom:  After system restart, pressing PS2 keyboard "ESC" key will not function.
#; RootCause: System couldn't catch PS2 keyboard input until PS2 keyboard driver was started. User has few time to press "ESC" key.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Remove IB10860213's modification because it will cause PS2 Keyboard response delay in SCU.
#;           2. Let system connect ConIn device early to get more time catching user's input.
#; SolutionDependency: IB10860215 fixes side effect of IB10860213. (Adopted in 05.11.35.0022)

#; Tag#: 05.11.35.0022
#; Issue#: IB11270166
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Performance
#; Symptom: (ITS:0040409)POST time over 9 sec on NewVariable structure.
#; RootCause: Because the FV "FVMAIN_COMPACT" is operation in SPI ROM,
#;            so cause decompress (About 2.5s) and measure FV image (Tcg2Pei is about 2s) are spend to much time.
#; Description: (Bug Fixed)
#; Solution: Force opration the FV "FVMAIN_COMPACT" in memory.

#; Tag#: 05.11.35.0021
#; Issue#: IB07220143
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: ACPI
#; Symptom: HDD unlock fail causes OS freeze after S3 resume.
#; RootCause: SATA device power off immediately with RTD3 result in device malfunction.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Set GPIO_22 (SATA port0 drive power pin, RVP1) to low in S3 sleep entry callback instead of Method(_OFF).
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB11270000
#; RelatedFiles:

#; Issue#: IB10860212
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: In case of system already has maximum variable, OS could BSOD or assert at reboot if user tried to create a new variable.
#; RootCause: It has a limit that system can't use up to maximum storage size or variable's number.

#; Solution:1. Reduce variable storage size to avoid a problem that system fail to set variable at remaining space.

#; Issue#: IB07220132

#; Category: Image

#; Tag#: 05.11.31.0018
#; Issue#: IB07220129
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: The monotonic counter is invalid when read NVM file data through HECI2.
#; RootCause: Exist two counters among RT and SMM CseVariableStorage driver.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Share single counter instance between RT and SMM CseVariableStorage driver.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB11270000
#; RelatedFiles:

#; Tag#: 05.11.30.0017
#; Issue#: IB06740506
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Flash
#; Symptom: When user flash bios with BiosLock and FPRR enable setting, after reboot, system will hang and show POST code 0x0000.
#; RootCause: Both BPDT1 and BPDT2 signature are destroyed by IHISI, the error handling is incorrect.
#; Description: (Bug Fixed)
#; Solution: 1. Correct EraseCount and WriteCount counter condition to enter error handler route.
#;           2. Return fail status when function FotaPrepare() failed to stop flash process.
#; SolutionDependency: None.
#; Reviewer: IB07220000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#; Tag#: 05.11.30.0017
#; Issue#: IB11270158
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Flash
#; Symptom: ITS 0037637: Platform key will changed to not enrolled after reflash BIOS.
#; RootCause: Because non-volatile variable was placed to Device Expansion region,
#;            If force to flash the Device Expansion region which will causes can't keep the platform key(Auth variable).
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution:  1. Protect Device Expansion region.

#; Tag#: 05.11.27.0014
#; Issue#: IB07220113
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Recovery
#; Symptom: Fast crisis recovery fail.
#; RootCause: Failed by RC100 update.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Skip to install event within constructor which driver unloaded during recovery mode.
#;           2. In order to avoid runtime exception, constructor to decide recovery mode and shorten Txe timeout.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07220113 fixes the side effect of IB07220089 (Adopted in 05.11.19.0012)
#; Reviewer: IB11270000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#; Tag#: 05.11.22.0014
#; Issue#: IB10860203
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Flash
#; Symptom: Flash will stop at 100% when SECURE_FLASH_SUPPORT = NO.                    
#; RootCause:  After system deleted several variables, TXE has no response. 
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Since Device Expansion region was cleared, skip KernelFbtsPurifyVariable().
#;           2. Force system to reboot after windows flash complete.
#; SolutionDependency: IB10860203 fixes side effect of IB10860201 (Adopted in 05.11.22.0013)
#; Reviewer: IB07220000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   3. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   4. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   5. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   6. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   7. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin

#; Tag#: 05.11.22.0014
#; Issue#: IB06740505
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: Recovery
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: Implement APL FOTA feature. (Backup CC1 to LBP2 before flash update)
#;              Related changes:
#;              1. Move IBBR from LPB2 to LBP1 because IBBR is for recovery and must be in CC1(Critical Components)
#;              2. Skip FTPM/HECI related code when boot mode is BOOT_IN_RECOVERY_MODE.
#;              3. Check BPDT1 and BPDT2 signature, if signature is not valid then enter recovery mode.
#;              4. Search NvCommon region by header "HFDM", not from BPDT table.
#; Solution: (New Feature)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07220000 
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#; Tag#: 05.11.22.0013
#; Issue#: IB07250254
#; Severity: Tweak
#; Category: Watchdog
#; Symptom: (Code Adjustment)
#; RootCause: (Code Adjustment)
#; Description: WHLK Watchdog Timer Test will cause Windows BSOD.
#;              SMM watchdog callback trigger NMI will cause BSOD that is normal behavior,
#;              Demo BIOS support its own Crash Dump feature that will run their own watchdog callback.
#;              ApolloLake code base didn't register SMM watchdog callback to do anything for avoid BSOD,
#;              when anyone triggers watchdog timer still will shutdown normally.
#; Solution: (Code Adjustment)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB03100000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#; Tag#: 05.11.22.0013
#; Issue#: IB02960837
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: S3 Resume
#; Symptom: (Bug Fix) In some OEM projects, implement ASPM table causes S3 / Resume hang up.
#; RootCause: After free memory which pointed by mPcieBridgeMap, it doesn't set mPcieBridgeMap to zero. It will cause this pointer free by other routine.     
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Set pointer to NULL after the memory is freed
#; SolutionDependency: IB02960837 fixes side effect of IB02960826 (Adopted in 05.11.16)
#; Reviewer: IB12740000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_B0_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#; Issue#: IB07220089
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Recovery
#; Symptom: Fast crisis recovery fail.
#; RootCause: Failed by RC081 update.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Expose eCmos before updating boot mode.

#;           3. Shorten Txe timeout to speed up recovery progress time.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB10860000

#; Modified:

#; Tag#: 05.11.17.0011
#; Issue#: IB07220071
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: FDM
#; Symptom: ITS 0039335: ApolloLake get NvCommon address by FDM fail in crisis recovery emu phase.
#; RootCause: In ApolloLake chipset, the get FDM function will refer PcdH2OFlashDeviceMapStart PCD.
#;            And it will be init in PlatformInitPreMem.c GetStage2FromSPICallBack function.
#;            But in crisis recovery emu phase, bios will call GetStage2FromRecoveryImage function only.
#;            So this PCD data will not be update to correct data.
#;            When bios call get FDM function in emu phase, it always return 0. 
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Set PcdH2OFlashDeviceMapStart in crisis recovery emu phase.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB10860000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   3. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   4. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   5. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\DnX_EMMC_X64_RELEASE.bin
#;   6. BroxtonChipsetPkg\PlatformInit\Pei\PlatformInitPreMem.c
#; 
#; Tag#: 05.11.17.0011
#; Issue#: IB07220070
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: Kernel
#; Symptom: (Kernel Code Update)
#; RootCause: (Kernel Code Update)
#; Description: Update Kernel from 05.11.16 to 05.11.17. Please refer to Kernel.txt for more details.
#;              Modify chipset / platform override which follow kernel code update.
#;              Please check below list for the solution issue# and relative files:
#;              (1) IB07010502 - Modify Package.dsc
#;              (2) IB02040510 - Modify PciEnumeratorSupport.c
#; Solution: (Kernel Code Update)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB10860000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Deleted:
#;   1. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Acpi\BootGraphicsResourceTableDxe\
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   3. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   4. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#;   10. Kernel.txt

#; Tag#: 05.11.16.0011
#; Issue#: IB08450344
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Platform
#; Symptom: (ITS:0039375) Platform will dead loop if trigger TXE disable pin
#; RootCause: HeciLib cannot successfully return current PTT status. It causes the code treats current target TPM is dTPM and tries to switch to fTPM continuously.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: When try to switch TPM device and HeciLib cannot do the operations, skip to do following operations.

#; Tag#: 05.11.16.0011
#; Issue#: IB08450341
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: TPM
#; Symptom: RuntimeFtpmDtpmSwitch feature does not work.
#; RootCause: 1. SCU does not provide switching items.
#;            2. Security page will show dTPM if BIOS configures to not use fTPM but FITC configures to use fTPM.
#;            3. Tpm2DeviceLib cannot access dTPM correctly.
#;            4. Cannot switch fTPM or dTPM by setup configuration.
#;            5. If RuntimeFtpmDtpmSwitch turned on, dTPM 1.2 will not work.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Replace TPM(accessing method) selection to fTPM/dTPM selection and turn on the feature by default.
#;           2. Change the policy of determination of fTPM. If PTT is activated, it will be treat target TPM is fTPM. Otherwise dTPM.
#;           3. Provide Tpm2InstanceLibDTpm for Tpm2DeviceLib. (Because there are function names collisions in Tpm2InstanceLibDTpm. Override Tpm2InstanceLibDTpm to change these functions to static functions.)
#;           4. If target TPM is different from configured one, call HeciLib to disable or enable PTT for switching.
#;           5. Change PEI TPM selection callback to set PcdTpmInstanceGuid to gTpmDeviceInstanceTpm20PttPtpGuid only if fTPM is selected. Otherwise use the value that determined by TreeConfigPeim.
#; SolutionDependency: None.
#; Reviewer: IB07220000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\SecurityPkg\
#;   2. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\SecurityPkg\Library\
#;   3. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\SecurityPkg\Library\Tpm2DeviceLibDTpm\
#;   4. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\SecurityPkg\Library\Tpm2DeviceLibDTpm\Tpm2InstanceLibDTpm.c
#;   5. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\SecurityPkg\Library\Tpm2DeviceLibDTpm\Tpm2InstanceLibDTpm.inf
#;   6. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\SecurityPkg\Library\Tpm2DeviceLibDTpm\Tpm2InstanceLibDTpm.uni
#;   7. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\SecurityPkg\Library\Tpm2DeviceLibDTpm\Tpm2Tis.c
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   3. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   4. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#; Tag#: 05.11.12.0010
#; Issue#: IB07220059
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Secure Boot
#; Symptom: (ITS:0039063) Platform can't boot to os if user continuously clear and load secure key.
#; RootCause: The reclaim mechanism is malfunction.
#;            The variable can be erased from Memory region by reclaim mechanism, 
#;            but can not be erased from SPI region. It further causes this issue.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Sync up to update variable region during the phase of erease block.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB11270000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#; 
#; Tag#: 05.11.09.0009
#; Issue#: IB10860193
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Platform
#; Symptom: System can't save Setup variable at runtime.
#; RootCause: PlatformConfigDataLib's setup data doesn't synchronized with Nvstorage at runtime.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Synchronizing Setup variable when system config was initialized.
#;           If Setup variable was set at runtime, use Nvstorage's Setup to update PlatformConfigDataLib's setup data.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07220000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:

#; Issue#: IB07220041
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: SPI
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: Rearrange NvCommon region to a fixed 4k-aligned address within OBB.
#;              - Add Pad mechanism to ensure 4k-aligned.
#;              - Move NvCommon behind to the Pad and always occupy the position.
#; Solution: (New Feature)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB11270000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:

#; Tag#: 05.11.05.0008
#; Issue#: IB11270146
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: OEM Service
#; Symptom: The OEM services "OemSvcGetBoardFabIds" will cause unexpected behavior in project board.
#; RootCause: The EC of project board is different from RVP, system will cause unexpected behavior 
#;            when the OemSvcGetBoardFabIds invoked before sending EC command.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Executed the OEM services "OemSvcGetBoardFabIds" prior to "GetBoardIdFabId".
#; SolutionDependency: IB11270146 fixes the side effect of IB11270143 (Adopted in 05.10.52.0006)
#; Reviewer: IB07220000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin
#;   2. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_1.bin
#;   3. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_EMMC_X64_RELEASE_8MB_2.bin
#;   4. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\APL_SPI_X64_RELEASE_8MB.bin

#; Tag#: 05.11.02.0006
#; Issue#: IB11270145
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Platform
#; Symptom: ITS 0038032: The PCI device SSIDSVID can't write proper value.
#; RootCause: SSID/SVID are wrote before the devices init in PEI phase. 
#;            The HDA of SSID/SVID is locked by FNCFG.BCLD in PEI phase,
#;            thus causes can't be set by OemSvcUpdateSsidSvidInfo in DXE phase.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Add OemSvcUpdateSsidSvidPei to program the devices SSID/SVID before devices init in PEI phase.
#; SolutionDependency: IB11270145 fixes the side effect of IB11270138 (Adopted in 05.10.47.0004)
#; Reviewer: IB07220000

#; Category: SMM

#; Tag#: 05.10.34.0002
#; Issue#: IB08450328
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: SCU
#; Symptom: (ITS:0037298) The "Total Memory" and "Channel A/B" show "Not Detected" in SCU.
#; RootCause: SMBIOS type 17 entry is not available. RC will log SMBIOS type 17 entries by DataHub protocol. It requires additional PiSmbiosRecordOnDataHubSmbiosRecordThunk driver for EDK2.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Add PiSmbiosRecordOnDataHubSmbiosRecordThunk driver and update corresponding code to fill SMBIOS 3.0 type 17 additional fields.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB10860000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\EdkCompatibilityPkg\
#;   2. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\EdkCompatibilityPkg\Compatibility\
#;   3. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\EdkCompatibilityPkg\Compatibility\PiSmbiosRecordOnDataHubSmbiosRecordThunk\
#;   4. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\EdkCompatibilityPkg\Compatibility\PiSmbiosRecordOnDataHubSmbiosRecordThunk\ConvTable.c
#;   5. BroxtonChipsetPkg\Override\EdkCompatibilityPkg\Compatibility\PiSmbiosRecordOnDataHubSmbiosRecordThunk\MemoryConv.c
#; Modified:
#;   1. ApolloLakeBoardPkg\Bios\BSW_X64_RELEASE.ROM
